articles.title: Icy Oceans Exist on Far-Off Moons. Why Aren’t They Frozen Solid? - Quanta Magazine
articles.description: The moons orbiting Jupiter and Saturn appear to have subsurface oceans — tantalizing targets in the search for life beyond Earth. But it’s not clear why these seas exist at all.
articles.content: Theyd based their prediction on the orbital dance of Jupiters largest moons. For every four orbits that Io completes, Europa makes two and Ganymede one. This orbital configuration, known as a resonan… [+3893 chars]
